questions.question: Which port of the 8051 microcontroller is commonly used for interfacing LEDs and other digital output devices?
In an 8051 microcontroller binary counter with LEDs, what is the typical purpose of the LEDs?

answers.b: To indicate the status of input/output pins

questions.question: If you want to interface eight LEDs with an 8051 microcontroller to display an 8-bit binary count, how many I/O pins would you need?
When the binary counter reaches its maximum value in an 8051 microcontroller setup with LEDs, what LED pattern is typically displayed before it resets to zero?
In an 8051 microcontroller binary counter LED project, how can you change the speed at which the LEDs cycle through the binary count?

answers.b: By altering the crystal oscillator frequency
answers.c: By modifying the LED resistor values
